channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2024050206
item.description:
Report E-2024050206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: CHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 1.45L glass bottle of Potassium Hydroxide Solution. It is estimated that 1-quart leaked out to the outer cardboard as a result of a loose cap. A Contractor identified and overpacked the leaking product as well as the cardboard that was impacted. One 55-gallon DF was generated for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report I-2024050019
item.description:
Report I-2024050019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: Dulles
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ? IFS CSR Lead met the flight upon arrival/ ? Pax Sean Allen Anderson in seat 29D had his electronic cigarette in his pocket.. ? Pax Anderson notified FA that his electronic cigarette is smoking and starting to burn up and handed to him willingly. ? FA took the electronic cigarette from Pax Anderson and informed the rest of the crew to retrieve the TCB. ? FA stated they saw a clear liquid starting to come from the electronic cigarette. ?FA conduct TCB SOP procedures. ? TCB was stowed in aft left Iavatory. Lavatory was closed and closely monitored for the remainder of the flight. ? TCB was used and no other fire equipment was used. ? No injuries were present and no medical equipment was used.
